alert.note: Alert for Edgefield; McCormick; Newberry; Saluda (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 18 at 2:12AM EST by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Lincoln, southern Newberry, northern Edgefield, Saluda and northeastern McCormick Counties through 245 AM EST... At 212 AM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles northeast of Mccormick County Airport, or 14 miles south of Greenwood, moving east at 55 mph. ...Boaters on Lake Strom Thurmond Should Seek Safe Harbor... HAZARD...Wind gusts over 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Newberry, Saluda, McCormick, Johnston, Prosperity, Saluda County Airport, Mccormick County Airport, Hamilton Branch State Park, Pomaria, Silverstreet, Parksville, Ward, Plum Branch, Saluda Co Sheriff`s Office, Good Hope, Northside Fire Station Main, Knox Scout Reservation, Double Branches, Hollywood Elementary School and Emory. This includes Interstate 26 between mile markers 77 and 83. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
